title: Watch Matt Damon and Ben Affleck in the first trailer for Netflix’s cop thriller ‘The Rip’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck star as Miami cops in Netflix's new thriller 'The Rip', streaming January 16.
The film involves a stash of dirty money found by Miami police, testing trust among officers.
Directed by Joe Carnahan, 'The Rip' draws inspiration from real events and classic 1970s cop thrillers.

title: Most of Mass. now in ‘significant’ drought, raising wildfire concerns
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts officials declare a significant drought in western, central, northeast regions, and Nantucket; southeast moves to mild drought.
August rainfall in Massachusetts was below average, leading to heightened wildfire concerns as warmer conditions persist.
Streamflow and groundwater levels are declining across Massachusetts, prompting calls for water conservation and vigilance from residents.

title: Read the statement from Arthur T. Demoulas’s camp after Market Basket firing
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Market Basket board removed Arthur T. Demoulas as CEO amid a corporate feud with his sisters controlling over 60% of the company.
Demoulas's spokesperson claims his firing was predetermined and alleges the board's actions were a coup against his leadership.
Demoulas remains committed to returning to Market Basket, despite mediation attempts to resolve the conflict failing.

title: Here’s why you’ll likely see long lines at Anna’s Taqueria locations today
author: John Waller
bullets: Anna's Taqueria celebrates 30 years by offering $3.50 super burritos on September 10, for one day only.
The promotion rolls back prices to 1995 levels, available both in-store and online with certain toppings extra.
Anna's Taqueria started on Beacon Street, Brookline, and now has 10 locations, including in Woburn and Natick.

title: Patriots rookie TreVeyon Henderson announces engagement
author: John Waller
bullets: Patriots rookie TreVeyon Henderson announced his engagement on Instagram with a photo featuring a 'Marry Me' sign.
Henderson, from Ohio State, frequently discusses only football and faith on social media.
Quarterback Drake Maye, who was recently married, might offer wedding planning advice to Henderson.

title: Red Sox rookie Connelly Early discussed his dominant MLB debut
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Connelly Early made his MLB debut for the Red Sox, pitching five scoreless innings against the Athletics.
Early struck out 11 batters, tying a team record for rookie debuts, as Boston won 6-0.
Early's composure and partnership with catcher Carlos Narváez were highlighted in his successful first start.

title: One injured in Boston scaffolding collapse
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A construction worker was injured in a scaffolding collapse on the third floor of a building in Boston's South End.
The worker was placed on concussion protocol after being safely extricated and transported to a local hospital.
The incident is under investigation by OSHA and a building inspector to determine the cause of the collapse.

title: Market Basket board votes to remove Arthur T. Demoulas
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Market Basket board voted unanimously to remove Arthur T. Demoulas as CEO following months of corporate tensions.
Demoulas was on paid leave amid allegations of planning a work stoppage and interfering with corporate oversight.
Demoulas's removal could have long-term impacts; past disputes led to employee protests and customer boycotts.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Sept. 10)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Abington home at 27 Camp St. sold for $710,000; 4 bedrooms, built in 1983, Cape Cod style.
Amesbury property at 21 Bailey Pond Lane #21 sold for $1,049,000; 3-bedroom, 4-bath condo townhouse.
Andover's 58 Abbot St., an antique house built in 1754, sold for $2,825,000; features 4 bedrooms, 5 baths.

title: Here’s who will be on the ballot in November’s 2025 City Council election
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Ruthzee Louijeune leads in at-large city councilor race with 18.71% of the vote, followed by Julia M. Mejia and Erin J. Murphy.
Gabriela Coletta Zapata dominates District 1 race with 76.77%, while Edward Flynn secures District 2 with 86.41% of votes.
Incumbent Enrique Pepén leads District 5 with 63.54%, Said Ahmed narrowly tops District 7 votes at 15.72% as the frontrunner.
